page.title: 02RHUM NATIONAL NATURE RESERVE
page.content: Rhum became a{National Nature Reserve in 1957 on its purchase from{Lady {Monica Bullough.}The outstanding natural features which justify its status include its unique and varied geology and mosaic of vegetation communities representative of N.W. Scotland; a large population of{Manx {Shearwaters;}1400{Red Deer;}4 pairs of {Golden Eagle}and other restricted species such as{Peregrine}and the {Norwegian Sandwort.}There is also a herd of{feral goats.}A further attribute, making Rhum an ideal site for ecological research, is that it is an island,with finite boundaries,where access & disturbance is limited & where no other interests impinge on management for wildlife conservation. The geology, flora & fauna, has been extensively surveyed & mapped & there is a continuous monitoring programme.
